title: The plane ticket upgrade option most U.S. airlines don't offer
description: Many global airlines offer upgrade auctions with passengers bidding on a better seat for their travel, but among US carriers, the idea is a non-starter.

title: Your boarding pass and weight, please: Why airlines are asking passengers to step on the scales
description: Airlines weigh passengers in the name of safety and fuel efficiency, often because it's required by law. But whether it's necessary depends on who you ask.

title: China's rare earths dominance makes U.S. supply chains vulnerable, trade representative says
description: China's dominance in rare earths makes U.S. supply chains vulnerable, U.S. Trade Representative Katherine Tai told CNBC's Martin Soong.

title: Here's how much exercise you should be doing each day, says expert: It's 'less than you might think'
description: You don't need as much exercise as you probably think. Fitness trainer Stephanie Mellinger shares how to make the most out of the minimum exercise you need per week.
